text: In Anglo-Saxon England, a Reeve was a local official with administrative responsibilities under the Crown. The main responsibilities of a reeve were: \- Administering the King's estates \- Collecting food renders from churls in order to supply the visiting royal court \- Monitoring labour services (such as unpaid work done by churls on the behalf of the landowner) \- Maintaining law and order at a local level Category:Anglo-Saxons
title: Reeve (England)
